title: Spatial-based Augmentation
description: This is a spatial-based augmentation technique that uses the spatial information of the input data to enhance the performance of the model. It is particularly useful in tasks where the spatial arrangement of the data is important, such as image classification and object detection.
author: Ngoc Duc

content.text: **Elastic Transformation** is a data augmentation which simulates the stretching and compressing of different parts of an image in various directions. The implementation typically involves generating random displacement fields that are convolved with a Gaussian kernel. This process creates natural-looking variations that preserve the essential characteristics of the original image while introducing meaningful diversity.

When applying elastic transformations, it's important to consider the **appropriate parameters** for your specific dataset. Too aggressive transformations might distort the semantic meaning of the images, while too subtle ones might not provide enough variation to be useful.

unexpectedInsights: Elastic transformations can sometimes reveal hidden features in medical imaging that weren't visible in the original scans.
The same parameters that work well for natural images often perform poorly on document images, suggesting domain-specific tuning is crucial.
notableObservations: Models trained with elastic transformations showed 15% better generalization to new data compared to those trained with only basic augmentations.
Combining elastic transformations with color jittering produced the best results in our experiments, outperforming either technique used alone.
